revised_title: MHC-Based Mating Preferences and Inbreeding Avoidance in Maintaining Genetic Diversity
tldr: This study investigates the role of infectious diseases, inbreeding, and mating preferences in maintaining MHC genetic diversity in house mice. The authors found that MHC-based mating preferences, which help avoid inbreeding, are more important in maintaining genetic variety than pathogen-driven selection. These findings suggest that inbreeding avoidance is the primary force diversifying MHC genes in species with similar mating patterns.
